entries.title: Chief Justice Roberts Emphasizes Judges’ Safety in Annual Report
entries.description: US Chief Justice John Roberts underscored the importance of judicial safety in his annual report released Saturday, saying “a judicial system cannot and should not live in fear.”

entries.title: Australia Pushes for Landmark Indigenous Referendum in 2023
entries.description: Australians could vote on changing the country’s constitution to set up a representative Indigenous body in parliament as early as August, Indigenous Australians Minister Linda Burney told the Sun-Herald newspaper.

entries.title: Canada Says Arrivals From China, HK Must Test Covid Negative
entries.description: Canada will require travelers arriving from China from Jan. 5 to provide evidence of a negative Covid-19 test result, taken no more than two days before their departure, to airlines prior to boarding.

entries.title: France’s Macron Says 2023 Will Be Year of Pension System Reform
entries.description: French President Emmanuel Macron pledged to push ahead next year with an unpopular overhaul of the country’s pension system that will effectively force people to work longer.

entries.title: Workers at Iran’s Abadan Refinery Strike as Protests Continue
entries.description: Workers at Iran’s biggest oil refinery went on strike on Saturday, impacting repairs and safety checks at the facility, according to unconfirmed reports and footage published on social media.

entries.title: Xi Says Tough Challenges Remain in New Phase of Covid Response
entries.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping said the country has entered a new phase in the development of Covid-19 and tough challenges remain.

entries.title: UK’s Problems Won’t ‘Go Away’ in New Year, Sunak Tells Britons
entries.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak warned Britons that the problems that dogged the country will not go away in 2023.

entries.title: Singapore’s Lee Warns of Uncertainties in 2023 as Risks Pile
entries.description: As the world leaves the worst of inflation behind in 2022, Singapore’s Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong warned of more pain in the new year from slowing economic growth.

entries.title: Taiwan Poised to Roll Out a $12.4 Billion Boost to the Economy
entries.description: The Taiwanese government is planning to deploy NT$380 billion ($12.4 billion) of funds to support the local economy and combat inflation amid global uncertainties, the presidential office said on Saturday.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Zelenskiy Pledges to Bolster Air Defense in 2023
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy vowed to reinforce his nation’s air defenses in the new year as Russia continues to strike critical infrastructure targets.

entries.title: China Factory Activity Worsens in December as Covid Spreads
entries.description: China’s manufacturing activity contracted at a steeper pace in December as the country suddenly reversed its Covid Zero policy and the virus swept through major cities, causing people to stay home and businesses to shut.
